task.description: 设计一种在25度下溶剂电极材料中贵金属的5组分DES溶剂

components.name: Choline chloride
components.function: Primary hydrogen bond acceptor, provides structural framework and low-cost ionic character

components.name: Ethylene glycol
components.function: Primary hydrogen bond donor, reduces viscosity and melting point, enhances conductivity

components.name: Glycerol
components.function: Secondary hydrogen bond donor to improve solvation power for metal ions and increase polarity

components.name: Urea
components.function: Amide-based donor that enhances nitrogen coordination to noble metals and further depresses eutectic temperature

components.name: Zinc chloride
components.function: Metallic salt additive acting as Lewis acid to coordinate with noble metals and promote oxidative dissolution

reasoning: This 5-component DES combines multiple HBDs (ethylene glycol, glycerol, urea) with choline chloride as the HBA and ZnCl₂ as a Lewis acidic promoter. The multi-component design allows fine-tuning of polarity, viscosity, and coordinating ability at 25°C, ensuring liquid state and high solvation capacity for noble metals like Au, Pd, or Pt. Urea and glycerol enhance complexation via O/N-donor sites, while ZnCl₂ promotes redox activity for oxidative leaching. Compared to binary systems, this formulation offers superior tunability and synergistic solvation.

components.name: Choline chloride
components.function: Primary hydrogen bond acceptor, provides structural framework and low-cost ionic character

components.name: Ethylene glycol
components.function: Primary hydrogen bond donor, reduces viscosity and melting point, enhances conductivity

components.name: Glycerol
components.function: Secondary hydrogen bond donor to improve solvation power for metal ions and increase polarity

components.name: Urea
components.function: Amide-based donor that enhances nitrogen coordination to noble metals and further depresses eutectic temperature

components.name: Zinc chloride
components.function: Metallic salt additive acting as Lewis acid to coordinate with noble metals and promote oxidative dissolution

final_result.reasoning: This 5-component DES combines multiple HBDs (ethylene glycol, glycerol, urea) with choline chloride as the HBA and ZnCl₂ as a Lewis acidic promoter. The multi-component design allows fine-tuning of polarity, viscosity, and coordinating ability at 25°C, ensuring liquid state and high solvation capacity for noble metals like Au, Pd, or Pt. Urea and glycerol enhance complexation via O/N-donor sites, while ZnCl₂ promotes redox activity for oxidative leaching. Compared to binary systems, this formulation offers superior tunability and synergistic solvation.
supporting_evidence: Choline chloride-ethylene glycol (1:2) is a well-known Type III DES (Reline), liquid at 25°C.
Addition of glycerol or urea to Reline analogues further depresses melting point and increases metal solubility (e.g., in recovery of Au from e-waste).
Polyols and amides act as multidentate ligands facilitating coordination to noble metal ions.
ZnCl₂-containing DES systems have demonstrated enhanced oxidative dissolution of gold in combination with HBDs (e.g., in deep eutectic solvents with ethaline + ZnCl₂).
Multi-component DES (quaternary and higher) are reported in literature for metal electrodeposition and extraction, showing improved performance over binaries.
final_result.synergy_explanation: Choline chloride and ethylene glycol form the foundational eutectic matrix, remaining liquid at 25°C. Glycerol and urea act cooperatively as additional HBDs to increase donor availability and polarity, enhancing solvation of cationic noble metal complexes. Urea also weakly coordinates to metals via nitrogen, while ZnCl₂ introduces Lewis acidity that facilitates oxidation of noble metals (e.g., Au → Au³⁺) when paired with oxidants. The combination results in a highly polar, low-viscosity, redox-active solvent ideal for electrochemical applications involving precious metals.
